intro: Secamone volubilis, commonly known as the creeping secamone, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures containing numerous tiny seeds. Secamone volubilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
